meanings.definition: To surpass in height or amount.
meanings.sent1: The tall tree overtopping the others in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper was overtopping all the buildings in the city.
meanings.sent3: The giraffe felt proud of overtopping the other animals at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was overtopping everyone else's.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak overtopping the clouds was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.sent1: The hot air balloon was overtopping the trees in the park.
meanings.sent2: The kite soared high, overtopping the rooftops.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to be overtopping his head comically.
meanings.sent4: Her joy was overtopping any previous happiness she had felt.
meanings.sent5: The sun was overtopping the horizon, painting the sky with colors.

meanings.definition: To exceed in importance or influence.
meanings.sent1: His kindness was overtopping his wealth in the community.
meanings.sent2: The leader's vision was overtopping all other proposals.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's cuteness was overtopping all the chaos in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was overtopping any obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song was overtopping all other sounds in the room.
